article:
'Skin folds' are areas of skin where it folds. Many skin folds are distinct,
heritable anatomical features, and may be used for identification of animal
species, while others are non-specific and may be produced either by individual
development of an organism or by arbitrary application of force to skin, either
by the actions of the muscles of the body or by external force, e.g., gravity.

Skin folds are of interest for cosmetology, since often they are undesirable
features, and for medicine, because many of them are susceptible to infection.
